ENGINEERING TECHNICIAN

SUMMARY

A challenging position in a Manufacturing, Engineering, or Research & Development environment where my overall technical background, along with my leadership and decision making capabilities will be combined to contribute to company goals, enlargement, & productivity.
Highlights
Excellent communication techniques Lean principles knowledge
Microsoft Excel & Word Engineering operational functions
Manufacturing systems integration

Personally managed production activities to guarantee 90 % of orders were shipped on-time.
Contributed to an increase in productivity through improvements in operations, quality, safety and administration.
Promoted to Production Supervisor within 8 years of employment.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Continuous Improvement Engineer

Location: New Bern-Morehead City Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Manufacturing, Project Management

Description:
We are hiring for a new opportunity as a Continuous Improvement Engineer to play a pivotal role in driving operational excellence within manufacturing and supply chain operations. You'll lead projects, optimize processes, and foster a culture of continuous improvement to ensure smooth operations and enhance customer satisfaction.
Key Responsibilities:
Optimize Processes: Identify opportunities for process improvement across supply chain, intralogistics, and warehouse areas based on your experience and insights from our team's unique challenges and successes.
Project Leadership: Lead cross-functional projects focused on improving material flow, inventory control, and operational efficiency. Collaborate with a dynamic team to create innovative solutions and make a real impact from day one.
Data-Driven Solutions: Utilize your analytical skills to analyze data, identify trends, and implement data-driven solutions that enhance productivity, reduce costs, and drive measurable results.
Technology Integration: Explore Industry 4.0 concepts and leverage tools like SAP to streamline logistics processes, improve accuracy, and adopt smart manufacturing practices.
Continuous Improvement Culture: Be a catalyst for change by promoting lean principles, conducting training sessions, and empowering team members to embrace operational excellence and drive continuous improvement initiatives.
Qualifications and Skills:
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering (Technical, Industrial) required; Master's Degree preferred.3-5 years of experience in technical supply chain/logistics engineering or related roles required; experience in manufacturing or warehouse operations highly valued.Strong analytical, communication, and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.Proven track record of driving process improvements, implementing best practices, and achieving measurable results in a manufacturing environment.
Why Join Us:
Work with a team that values innovation and entrepreneurial spirit, where you can make a real impact and shape the future of our operations.Collaborate with a supportive manager who is committed to your growth and success, offering mentorship and opportunities to lead impactful projects.Opportunity to make an impact immediately in a highly visible role but also advance your career in an industry leading company

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
